meanings.definition: To boast more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Tom outbragged his friends about his new bike.
meanings.sent2: She always outbragged everyone about her accomplishments.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outbragged the birds about finding the biggest acorn.
meanings.sent4: The waves outbragged each other as they crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent5: The sun outbragged the clouds, shining brightly in the sky.

meanings.sent1: He outbragged so much that no one believed his stories anymore.
meanings.sent2: She outbragged about her cooking skills, but burnt the dinner.
meanings.sent3: The cat outbragged the dog about catching mice, but the dog caught more.
meanings.sent4: The wind outbragged itself, howling loudly through the night.
meanings.sent5: The flowers outbragged each other, showing off their vibrant colors.
